io.analytics.repository

Class GoogleAccountRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.analytics.repository.GoogleAccountRepository
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGoogleAccountRepository

    @Repository
public class GoogleAccountRepository
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGoogleAccountRepository
    A repository for querying and updating GoogleAccounts in the database.
    Author:
    Dave Wong

    • Method Detail

      • addGoogleAccount

        public GoogleAccount addGoogleAccount(GoogleAccount account)
        Adds a new Google Account into the database. The GoogleAccount must have a refresh token and an owner id set in order to add it to the database.
        Specified by:
        addGoogleAccount in interface IGoogleAccountRepository
        Parameters:
        account - The GoogleAccount to add to the database.
        Returns:
        Returns true on success, false otherwise.

      • getGoogleAccountsForOwner

        public java.util.List<GoogleAccount> getGoogleAccountsForOwner(int ownerId)
        Retrieves a list of Google accounts owned by one particular user. Note that this is different from a list of Google Accounts associated with one particular Account.
        Specified by:
        getGoogleAccountsForOwner in interface IGoogleAccountRepository
        Parameters:
        ownerId - The User id that you are trying to find Google Accounts for.
        Returns:
        A List of GoogleAccounts, which may be empty if none are found.

      • addRelationshipToAccount

        public boolean addRelationshipToAccount(int googleAccountId,
                               int accountId)
        Description copied from interface: IGoogleAccountRepository
        Adds an access relationship between a Google Account and an Account. The given Account will be given access to the provided Google Account.
        Specified by:
        addRelationshipToAccount in interface IGoogleAccountRepository
        Parameters:
        googleAccountId - The Google Account ID.
        accountId - The Account ID.
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeded, false otherwise.
